Mr.Neelabh
yes it is possible ..actually autometically you are exercising your   jav  code by calling all the methods by using broad  range of input  values in a variety of  sequence..and reporting the result.
After this process  some observation will come..here observation are description of behavoiur.if you feel this observtaion are intended behavoiur  promote them to  valid  assertion.
Every assertion became  a test cases for you..
hope you got it now..
Any problem  let me  know 
Thax
raj


is there any demo available?
has any body worked on this?

"J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
Shivam giri wrote:
> Dear all
> There is a good news for you all if you are using JUnit  extensively..
> One revolutenery  technology has came called  as Agitation..software 
> agitation..
> Its a automated uint testing tool for java devlopers..and u don't  have 
> right any test cases
> u will get eveything autometically....www.agitar.com and above all its 
> come with dashboard where u will get the report of entire project..

Interesting.

How does a computer know what kinds of tests I need to write? How does a 
computer know what the expected results are?
